definition: impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: She admonished the boy and asked him to redo his entry.
sentences.chinese: 她批評了這名男生，並要求他重做一篇讀後感。

sentences.english: Another method of writing about what you have read is to respond to the reading.
sentences.chinese: 讀後感的另一種方法是與所讀的內容產生互動。

sentences.english: Okay. The reading response for next week is a simple one.
sentences.chinese: 好了，下週的作業是一篇簡單的讀後感。

sentences.english: Fourth, the heart has been fixed, write book review.
sentences.chinese: 第四，心有所動，寫讀後感。

sentences.english: I know I've been giving difficult reading responses.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我以前佈置的讀後感都很難。

sentences.english: Write something about your feelings after reading.
sentences.chinese: 讓學生寫簡單的讀後感。

definition: random thoughts/(in book titles etc) impressions/jottings
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
a popular form of narrative literature flourishing in the Tang Dynasty (618-907) with alternate prose and rhymed parts for recitation and singing (often on Buddhist themes)
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
